nodes.label: Limitation
nodes.description: The study is limited to only one dataset, the Kaggle Credit Card Fraud Detection Dataset, which may not be indicative of other datasets or real-world scenarios.

nodes.label: Limitation
nodes.description: The use of SHAP for feature selection adds a distinct step in the process and requires more computational resources compared to built-in feature selection methods.

nodes.label: Limitation
nodes.description: The comparison is limited to specific classifiers and does not include other possible models that could affect the outcome of the feature selection methods.

nodes.label: Limitation
nodes.description: SHAP values may vary when different trained models are utilized, leading to variability in rankings and results.

edges.description: Results may not generalize well to other types of data or domains beyond credit card fraud detection.
This additional computational expense might make SHAP less practical for large datasets or real-time applications.
The findings might not be applicable to other types of classifiers which were not studied in this paper.
The reliability and consistency of SHAP rankings across different model runs can affect the interpretation and use of selected features.
